intro: Pouteria spicata, commonly known as the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon Basin. It is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into elongated, woody pods. The tree is notable for its edible seeds, which are commercially harvested as Brazil nuts. The fruit contains 12–24 hard-shelled seeds, each encased in a fibrous membrane. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is an important component of the rainforest ecosystem.
